DOCNAME: CASE OF MAMMAD MAMMADOV v. AZERBAIJAN
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Erik Møse;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . He is currently serving a life sentence in LOC .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant , as a member of a small group of “ volunteers ” from GPE , underwent military training organised by NORP militants based in GPE ’s FAC . The aim of this training was subsequent participation in insurgent operations against the NORP Federal forces in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant returned to ORG in DATE . On DATE he was arrested . On CARDINAL DATE ORG convicted him of forming an illegal armed group under LAW and gave him a suspended sentence of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested again . On DATE he was indicted in ORG on charges of premeditated aggravated murder , firearms smuggling , illegal possession of firearms , creation of an illegal armed group , and illegal border crossing under Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty as charged and sentenced him to life imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against this judgment . He complained , in particular , that the facts of the case had not been assessed correctly , that he had not intended to kill law - enforcement officers and that ORG had erred in applying and interpreting the criminal law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his appeal and upheld the first - instance judgment . The appeal hearing was held in the applicant ’s absence . His lawyer was present .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a cassation appeal . He reiterated his previous complaints claiming the misapplication of the relevant criminal law . He did not complain about his absence from the hearing before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in the presence of the public prosecutor . The applicant and his lawyer had not been summoned to that hearing . ORG upheld the lower courts’ judgments .

CARDINAL . The applicant is held , together with CARDINAL other inmate , in a cell measuring CARDINAL x QUANTITY . The cell has CARDINAL beds , a small bedside cupboard , and CARDINAL small table and CARDINAL chairs fixed to the cell floor . The toilet area is separated from the rest of the cell . The floor and ceiling are made of stone and concrete respectively . The temperature inside the cell is very high in DATE and very low in DATE . Central heating is available , but insufficient .

CARDINAL . The window with metal bars has no windowpane in it and , in DATE , is closed with a transparent polyethylene film . The air inside is stale and the cell can not be naturally ventilated . The food served in the prison is often of poor quality and lacks sufficient meat and vitamins , and the menu is unvaried and monotonous . The inmates are only allowed TIME of outdoor exercise per day .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s cell is assigned to CARDINAL inmates and measures CARDINAL x QUANTITY . The conditions of the applicant ’s detention meet all national and international requirements and standards . The window of the cell can be opened from the inside . The window is large enough and does not prevent natural light and fresh air from coming in . The cell is also equipped with electric lamps , a ventilator and a radio set .

CARDINAL . Since DATE the prisoners have had the right to watch TV for TIME per day and for TIME at weekends and on holidays . The prison has a library accessible to the prisoners . Sanitary conditions are normal and the food served is of good quality . The applicant has the right to TIME of outdoor exercise per day .
